intro: Rindera cristulata, commonly known as the crested rindera, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, often branched stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow and are clustered in umbels. Rindera cristulata is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
